title: Ticket #1503: SOAP useless D_ALWAYS level
description:
in "int DaemonCore::HandleReq(Stream insock, Stream asock)" (condor_daemon_core.V6/daemon_core.cpp around line 4112), the SOAP code path logs several messages at D_ALWAYS. The generated lines look like thiS: 

07/14 14:02:57 About to serve HTTP request...
07/14 14:02:57 Completed servicing HTTP request

That seems of limited value, especially at the D_ALWAYS level. We don't normally log "normal" condor commands. A user making heavy use of the SOAP interface will find his log filling much more quickly than another user doing the same operations with condor_q/condor_submit/etc. Perhaps it should be downgraded to D_DAEMONCORE or D_FULLDEBUG?

As an added bonus it would be nice if the command was included in those lines (getVersionString, submit, etc)
